properties.address: Parton Road, Gloucestershire GL3 2AF
properties.description: Churchdown Library is located on Parton Road and has ramped access. Libraries are traditionally a place where people can go without judgement or cost and we offer a range of core services all year round. What we are offering: •Warm, dry spaces to sit and keep warm •Free access to Wi-Fi and free computer access with a Library membership •Places to charge your devices •Signposting to advice and support •Regular groups, activities and events ranging from jigsaw puzzles to social sessions Library membership is free! Join online or at your local library. Explore more at gloslibraries.uk Discover services, catch up on news, and browse events for all ages.

properties.address: Northway Community Hub & Parish Office, Gloucestershire, Gloucestershire GL20 8QG
properties.description: Northway Community Hub will be open as a Warm Space on a Mondays and Tuesdays between 10.00 am and 2.00 pm. The atrium has café style tables as well as some comfier seats. Disabled toilets and disabled access. Kitchen with hatch for serving. Wi-fi available upon request of password. Free hot drinks, biscuits, fresh fruit and crisps available and hot soup and rolls served at lunch time. Magazines, newspapers, puzzles and games as well as children's colouring books and some toys.
properties.title: Northway Community Hub

properties.address: 1 Matson Avenue, Gloucester, Gloucestershire
properties.description: Open from 1 October 2023 We provide craft materials and games, plus a quiet space where it's ok not to be ok
properties.title: Renew1 at Matson Baptist Church

properties.address: Century Hall,, CHELTENHAM, Glos GL51 4TB
properties.description: Open Mondays at Shurdington Community Centre Century Hall is open from 11am – 4pm to anyone who wants to come along on the second and last Monday of the month. There will be refreshments – soup, sandwich or full meal – and always tea/coffee/biscuits. There is no charge and all are welcome. You can read the newspaper, do a jigsaw, play table tennis, charge your phone or just have a rest and a chat. Between 2pm and 4pm, there will be a family film showing on our cinema system – come along and enjoy - or get involved and request a favourite film. There are play facilities for children and on the last Monday of the month, there is an NHS run Baby Hub ALL WELCOME - SEE YOU THERE!
properties.title: Shurdington Community Centre

properties.address: Soldiers Of Gloucestershire Museum, Gloucestershire GL1 2HE
properties.description: We have a cafe with seating available and a great community atmosphere. The heating will be on and there are plenty of staff, volunteers and visitors to engage with.

properties.address: Staunton & Corse Community Hub, Staunton, Gloucester, Gloucestershire GL19 3QA
properties.description: The Hub is a volunteer run cafe, pub and community venue, open Wednesdays to Fridays 11am - 3pm and Fridays 5.30pm - 10.30pm. We have various daytime clubs and evening events running every month. On Fridsys from 10th November we're offering a free tea or coffee to anyone needing to warm up.
properties.title: Staunton & Corse Community Hub

properties.address: Station Road, TEWKESBURY, Gloucestershire GL20 5DR GL20 5DR
properties.description: The space consists of a lounge area where people can sit and socialise. There will be other activities going on if folks wish to join in they are very welcome. Some of these are run by outside groups who may charge. Hot drinks will be available and on occasions soup and a roll at lunchtime on Tuesday and Friday. All are welcome. On Wednesday morning during term time, we have a parent and baby/toddler group. Tuesday lunchtime during term time soup and roll are available. Snack breakfast on Sundays between 9:30am and 10:15am

properties.address: Ledbury Methodist Church, Ledbury, Herefordshire HR8 2AA
properties.description: Ledbury Methodist Church can be found in Bye Street, Ledbury HR8 2AA, on the access road to Bye Street Car Park. We can offer conversation or a quiet space to work. We have a place for small children to play. We can look things up for you on the internet or refer you to support groups and help. As well as a warm welcome, and a physically warm space, we can offer refreshments, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, squash, milk. Toast, Beans on Toast, and Soup. We'll be open on Mondays from 10:30am to 1pm. We are adjacent to 2 council car parks
properties.title: Warm Welcome
